title: Putin to Announce Ukraine Annexation Plans on Friday
description: There was no sign that any other country would recognize Russia’s move, but Mr. Putin may try to use the plans to shift attention away from his losses on the battlefield.

title: Downpours From Ian Prompt Florida Treatment Plants to Release Waste
description: Concern turns to industrial sites and huge farms farther north as the storm heads toward South Carolina.

title: What to Know About Russia’s Annexation of Four Ukrainian Provinces
description: The Kremlin is using pageantry and a show of adhering to Russian legal formalities to give the move a veneer of legitimacy.

title: Russia Plans to Illegally Annex Lands It Invaded, Even as Its Military Falters
description: Even though Russia has failed to fully control the four territories it seeks to annex, the Kremlin is preparing a show designed to present a sheen of legitimacy to its illegal takeover.

title: US Penalizes Chinese Companies for Aiding Iran’s Oil Exports
description: The move suggests a more aggressive approach by the Biden administration after talks to revive a 2015 nuclear deal faltered.

title: Russia plans to illegally annex lands it invaded, even as its military falters.
Shakira Is Accused of Tax Evasion in Spain. Here’s What We Know.
description: Prosecutors have charged the Colombian singer and pop star with six counts of tax fraud for failing to pay 14.5 million euros in income taxes. She could face a steep fine and a prison sentence.

title: Russa Plans to Annex Land in Ukraine
description: Plus the destruction from Hurricane Ian and Zambia’s honeymoon.

title: Vatican Disciplined Nobel Laureate Bishop Over Child Abuse Claims
description: After accusations against him became public, the Vatican said that in 2020 it had punished Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo, a hero of the independence movement in his native East Timor.

title: Gas Flares Might Release More Methane Than Thought, Study Finds
description: Flaring, meant to burn off the planet-warming gas at industrial sites, doesn’t always work as intended, according to researchers.

title: Russia Beat and Denied Food to Prisoners of War, Ukraine Says
description: Evidence of Russian abuses of captives has fueled outrage and added to a litany of reports of Russian war crimes.

title: Pentagon Plans to Set Up a New Command to Arm Ukraine, Officials Say
description: The mission in Germany would streamline a training and assistance system that the United States and its allies created on the fly after Russia’s invasion, officials said.

title: Zelensky’s Answer to Escalating Russian Threats: Defiance
description: In a nightly address, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine told Russian soldiers: “If you want to live, run.”

title: Queen Elizabeth’s Death Certificate Reveals Cause and Time of Death
description: Queen Elizabeth died of “old age” at 3:10 p.m. on Sept. 8, the paperwork shows.

title: China’s ‘Absurd’ Covid Propaganda Stirs Rebellion
description: The use of propaganda in the country has been on overdrive in the pandemic, with some Chinese citizens arguing the language has bordered on “nonsense.”

title: North Korea Fires Two Missiles, Third Test in a Week
description: The test took place hours after Vice President Kamala Harris met with South Korea’s president to discuss their nations’ alliance.

title: Mexico Named Deadliest Country for Environmental Activists
description: A new report from the watchdog group Global Witness found that 54 land rights activists were killed in Mexico last year, the most of any country.

title: The E.U. proposes a fresh round of sanctions against the Kremlin over ‘sham’ referendums.
Hospitals in Coastal Cities Risk Flooding Even in ‘Weak’ Hurricanes, Study Finds
description: In a third of the 78 cities examined on the Atlantic and Gulf coasts, half or more of hospitals were at risk from a Category 2 storm, the researchers said.

title: Finland Closes Border to Russian Tourists
description: The long-planned move closes off the last land route into the European Union for people fleeing Russia’s military mobilization effort.

title: The Kashmiri Chef Foraging on Precarious Soil
description: For Prateek Sadhu, gathering native ingredients in the conflict zone where he grew up is the only way of asserting Kashmir’s tenuous place in the world.

title: Ian Moves North
description: We have the latest on Hurricane Ian, another storm to gather strength with frightening speed.

title: Felicien Kabuga, Rwanda Genocide Tribunal’s Most Wanted, Is on Trial
description: Félicien Kabuga lived on the run for 23 years before his arrest in France in 2020. He is accused of backing the groups that oversaw the killing of hundreds of thousands of people in 1994.

title: The Last Days of an Outback Town Where Every Breath Can Be Toxic
description: The town of Wittenoom, ruined by asbestos mining, will be wiped off the face of the earth. But first the government had to remove those who wanted to stay.

title: Lula Is Back From Prison and Could Be Brazil’s Next President, Again
description: Former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva is trying to cap a stunning political comeback by defeating the incumbent Jair Bolsonaro in Brazil’s elections on Sunday.

title: New Infectious Threats Are Coming. The US Probably Won’t Contain Them.
description: The coronavirus revealed flaws in the nation’s pandemic plans. The spread of monkeypox shows that the problems remain deeply entrenched.

title: Despite Iran’s Efforts to Block Internet, Technology Has Helped Fuel Outrage
description: Online, Iranians engage in a world their leaders don’t want them to see.

title: Britain’s Gamble on Tax Cuts has Economists Warning of Past Mistakes
description: The International Monetary Fund is just one of the many voices that have criticized a plan to cut rates for high earners.

title: New U.S. Military Aid Will Take Years to Deliver
description: The Pentagon is ordering the rocket system launchers it said it would send as part of a $1.1 billion package, suggesting a shift to supporting Ukraine in a long, open-ended war.

title: On Eve of Election, Bolsonaro’s Party Attacks Brazil’s Voting Systems
description: Four days before Brazilians vote, President Jair Bolsonaro’s political party formally claimed, without evidence, that government employees could alter ballots.

title: Australian Economic Adviser Sentenced to Three Years in Myanmar
description: Sean Turnell, arrested five days after the military seized power in a coup, has been convicted by the junta of violating the country’s official secrets act.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: A veneer of respectability over Moscow’s land grab.
